articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mediator Qatar has handed Israel and Hamas a "final" draft of a ceasefire and hostage release agreement designed to end the war in Gaza, an official briefed on the negotiations told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Qatar hands Israel, Hamas 'final' draft of Gaza ceasefire deal, official tells Reuters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Aircraft dropped water and fire retardant on steep hills to stem the eastward spread of the Palisades Fire. The LA county supervisor called it "another night of unimaginable terror and heartbreak."
articles.title: San Fernando Valley under threat as Los Angeles fire rages on

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin prepared for the inaugural launch of its New Glenn rocket from Florida early on Monday, nearing a pivotal debut in Earth orbit that will mark a major step towards a long-awaited goal of competing with Elon Musk's SpaceX in the satellite launch market.
articles.title: Bezos' Blue Origin prepares for debut New Glenn rocket launch

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "There will undoubtedly be more," he said.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says he's ready to exchange N. Korean soldiers for Ukrainians held in Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan, the Philippines and the United States vowed to further strengthen their ties under a trilateral arrangement in the face of growing tensions in regional waters, Manila said on Monday following a call among their leaders.
articles.title: Japan, Philippines, U.S. vow to deepen cooperation, Manila says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are expected to have a call in the coming days or weeks, and it is unrealistic to aim to expel Russian soldiers from every inch of Ukrainian territory, a top Trump adviser said.
articles.title: Trump call with Putin expected soon, Trump adviser says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nahid Taghavi, an Iranian-German women's rights activist, has been released from prison and is back in Germany after more than four years incarceration in Iran, Amnesty International said on Monday.
articles.title: German-Iranian women's rights activist released from Iranian prison

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwanese charged with suspicion of spying on behalf of China rose by a third to 64 people last year, the island's National Security Bureau said, adding most were current or retired soldiers.
articles.title: Taiwan reports 'significant rise' in suspected Chinese espionage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Denmark recognises that the United States has security interests in the Arctic and is ready to discuss these with the incoming administration of President-elect Donald Trump, Danish Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen said on Monday.
articles.title: Danish foreign minister says we are ready for talks on legitimate US security interests in Arctic

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nigeria's air force said it was investigating reports of civilian casualties during a weekend air strike that targeted armed gangs in the northwest, the latest military operation where innocent people may have been accidentally killed.
articles.title: Nigeria's air force investigates civilian deaths after air strike
